title: Analysis of Solvent Properties of Mandarin Oil
reasoning: The abstract states that mandarin oil, primarily composed of limonene, can replace tetrachloroethylene as a solvent and describes limonene as a safe, non-toxic organic solvent with high performance. This explicitly indicates limonene as a safer alternative to tetrachloroethylene.

target_chemical_harm.rationale: The reasoning text does not explicitly state any harms or hazards related to tetrachloroethylene. It only mentions that mandarin oil can replace benzene, methylbenzene, and tetrachloroethylene as a solvent, and describes limonene as safe and non-toxic, but does not provide any explicit information about the hazards of tetrachloroethylene.
